eventDescription: Infinity Hunt is a thrilling treasure hunt-style event that combines the excitement of discovery with the challenge of mental acuity. The event features a unique combination of aptitude questions, coding challenges, and engaging puzzles. Participants will solve clues, crack codes, and race against time to reach the final destination.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Mandatory Attendance
rulesAndRegulations.description: All participants must report on time and attend the entire event from start to end (9:30 AM to 3:30 PM). Late entries or early exits may lead to disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Group Participation Etiquette
rulesAndRegulations.description: Groups must stay together during the hunt. Splitting up to solve clues individually is not allowed and will result in penalty points.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Respect for Venue
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants must not damage property or tamper with equipment in labs, cabins, or buildings. Any such behavior will lead to immediate disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: No External Help
rulesAndRegulations.description: The use of mobile phones, the internet, or assistance from outsiders is strictly prohibited unless specified in a challenge. All answers must be solved independently by the team.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Clue Integrity
rulesAndRegulations.description: Do not remove, hide, or alter any clues once found. If you find a clue meant for another team, report it to the coordinators.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 – Aptitude Clash
eventRounds.description: Participants will face logic-based aptitude and reasoning questions. Top scorers will move to the next round.

eventRounds.title: Round 2 – Code Crypt
eventRounds.description: A coding challenge where participants solve puzzles or decode logic to find clues.

eventRounds.title: Final Round – The Hunt
eventRounds.description: The ultimate treasure hunt round across the venue, filled with hidden clues, riddles, and tech puzzles.

warnings: Be ready for outdoor and indoor challenges.

faqs.question: Can I participate alone?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can register as an individual or in a group of up to 4 members.

faqs.question: What if I miss the registration deadline?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, late registrations will not be accepted. Please register before the deadline.

faqs.question: Is there any age limit for participants?
faqs.answer: No, there is no age limit. All engineering students are welcome to participate.

faqs.question: Will food be provided during the event?
faqs.answer: Yes, lunch and refreshments will be provided to all participants.

eventDescription: CodeRumble is a fast-paced competitive coding and debugging event designed to test participants’ problem-solving skills under pressure. This event includes logical challenges, real-world debugging, and algorithm optimization rounds.
eligibleParticipants: Open to all engineering students with a basic understanding of programming.

rulesAndRegulations.title: No Internet Access
rulesAndRegulations.description: Participants are not allowed to use the internet during coding rounds unless explicitly permitted in a challenge.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Individual Effort
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each participant must solve problems independently. Collaboration during solo rounds will result in disqualification.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Respect Time Limits
rulesAndRegulations.description: Each round has strict time constraints. Late submissions will not be evaluated.

rulesAndRegulations.title: Software & Environment
rulesAndRegulations.description: All coding must be done in the provided software environment. External IDEs or tools are not allowed.

eventRounds.title: Round 1 – Bug Bash
eventRounds.description: Identify and fix bugs in code snippets under a time constraint.

eventRounds.title: Round 2 – Algo Blitz
eventRounds.description: Solve algorithmic problems with increasing difficulty. Partial scoring will be based on test case coverage.

eventRounds.title: Final Round – Code Sprint
eventRounds.description: A real-world scenario problem with edge cases and optimization needs.

warnings: Basic knowledge of C++/Python/Java is expected.
Be on time for each round.

faqs.question: Can I participate in a group?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can register as a team of 2–4 members for team rounds.

faqs.question: Which languages are allowed?
faqs.answer: You can choose between C++, Java, or Python.

faqs.question: Do I need to bring my own laptop?
faqs.answer: No, systems will be provided. However, you can bring your own if you prefer.

faqs.question: Will I get a participation certificate?
faqs.answer: Yes, all participants will receive certificates.
